alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 11:37AM CDT until August 26 at 11:12PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including northern Tangipahoa Parish and northwestern Washington Parish. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, with water possibly covering some roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour over portions of the advisory area with heavy rain ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kentwood, Mount Herman and Tangipahoa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
